meanings.definition: To treat or combine with bromine.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will brominate the water to make it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: They brominate the pool water to keep it clean and clear.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally brominated my sandwich with too much mustard.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to brominate the sky with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The chef's special sauce will brominate the flavors of the dish.

meanings.definition: To undergo a reaction involving bromine.
meanings.sent1: The chemical compound will brominate when exposed to light.
meanings.sent2: The metal will slowly brominate over time, forming a new substance.
meanings.sent3: The potion unexpectedly brominated, creating a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to brominate throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere began to brominate with tension as the meeting went on.
